bibl.title: Albert Friedrich v. State of Washington. Petition
bibl.note: Our transcription is based on a digital image of the microfilmed original.

org.orgName: United States Circuit Court, District of Washington, Northern Division

div1.p: TO THE HONORABLE, THE CIRCUIT COURT OF THE UNITED STATES, DISTRICT OF WASHINGTON, NORTHERN DIVISION.
IN THE MATTER OF THE APPLICATION OF ALBERT FREDERICH FOR A WRIT OF HABEAS CORPUS.

THE COMPLAINT OF ALBERT FREDERICH RESPECTFULLY SHOWS THAT HE IS NOW A PRISONER CONFINED IN THE STATE PENETENTIARY OF THE STATE OF WASHINGTON, AT WALLA WALLA IN THE SAID STATE IN THE CUSTODY OF WARDEN OF SAID PENETENTIARY.

THAT HIS IMPRISONMENT IS BY VIRTUE OF A WARRANT and judgment A COPY OF WHICH IS HERETO ATTACHED AND MARKED EXHIBIT "A" "and B", AND NOT OTHER- WISE; AND THAT THIS COMPLAINANT IS INFORMED BY HIS COUNSEL MESSRS TYLER & TYLER AND VERILY BELIEVES THAT HIS IMPRISONMENT IS ILLEGAL AND THAT SUCH ILLEGALITY CONSISTS IN THIS TO-WIT

THAT COMPLAINANT WAS DULY INDICTED BY THE GRAND JURY OF KING COUNTY, STATE OF WASHINGTON, ONE THE 17 DAY OF July 1891 FOR THE MURDER OF ONE JULIUS SCHERBRING, AND UPON SAID IN- DICTMENT, HE WAS DULY ARRAIGNED, PLEADED NOT GUILTY WAS TRIED BY A JURY WHO FOUND HIM GUILTY OF MURDER IN THE FIRST DEGREE ON THE 26th DAY OF September 1891
THAT COMPLAINT MOVED SAID COURT FOR A NEW TRIAL WHICH WAS DENIED, AND THERE UPON SAID COURT SENTENCED THIS COMPLAINANT TO BE HUNG.
THAT THEREUPON THIS COMPLAINANT APPEALED TO THE SUPREME COURT OF SAID STATE FROM SAID JUDGMENT AND FROM THE ORDER OF SAID COURT DENYING HIM A NEW TRIAL.

THAT UPON SAID APPEAL SUCH PROCEEDINGS WERE HAD IN SAID SUPREME COURT, THAT SAID COURT REVERSED, ANNULLED AND SET ASIDE THE SAID JUDGMENT AND REMANDED SAID CAUSE TO THE SUPERIOR COURT WITH INSTRUCTIONS TO THE SAID COURT TO SENTENCE THIS COMPLAINANT WITHOUT ANY OTHER TRIAL OR VERDICT OF A JURY, AS FOR MURDER IN THE SECOND DEGREE.

THAT ON THE 16TH DAY OF JUNE 1891 THIS COMPLAINANT WAS BROUGHT BEFORE SAID SUPERIOR COURT. ADJUDGED TO BE GUILTY OF MURDER IN THE SECOND DEGREE BY SAID COURT,BY DIRECTION OF SAID SUPREME COURT, AND SENTENCED TO IMPRISONMENT IN THE STATE PENETENTIARY OF THE STATE OF WASHINGTON, FOR THE TERM OF TWENTY YEARS.

THAT COMPLAINANT IS ADVISED BY HIS COUNSEL, AND VERILY BEL- IEVES THAT HE HAS BEEN SINCE THE 16TH DAY OF JUNE,1892, AND IS NOW DEPRIVED OF HIS LIBERTY WITHOUT DUE PROCESS OF LAW, IN VIOLAT ION OF THE XIV. AMENDMENT TO THE CONSTITUTION OF THE UNITED STATES.
WHEREFORE, YOUR COMPLAINANT PRAYS THAT A WRIT OF HABEAS CORPUS MAY ISSUE FROM THIS HONORABLE COURT COMMANDING THE SAID

WARDEN OF THE STATE PENETENTIARY OF WASHINGTON TO HAVE THE BODY OF YOUR COMPLAINANT BEFORE THIS HONORABLE COURT, AT SUCH TIME AS TO THE COURT SHALL SEEM MEET. THAT THIS HONORABLE COURT ADJUDGE THE IMPRISONMENT OF YOUR COMPLAINANT TO BE ILLEGAL AND DIRECT HIM TO BE DISCHARGED AND YOUR COMPLAINANT AS IN DUTY BOUND WILL EVER PRAY ETC.
Albert Friedrich
COMPLAINANT.
STATE OF WASHINGTON, COUNTY OF WALLA WALLA;
ALBERT FREDERICH BEING DULY SWORN DEPOSES AND SAYS: THAT HE HAS READ THE FOREGOING COMPLAINT AND KNOWS THE CONTENTS THEREOF AND THE SAME IS TRUE OF HIS OWN KNOWLEDGE.
Albert Friedrich
SUBSCRIBED AND SWORN TO BEFORE ME THIS 15 DAY OF JULY, 1892.
J
NOTARY PUBLIC IN AND FOR THE STATE OF WASHINGTON, RESIDING AT WALLA WALLA.
(Exhibit A.)
IN THE SUPERIOR COURT OF THE STATE OF WASHINGTON, FOR THE COUNTY OF KING.
THE STATE OF WASHINGTON,
PLAINTIFF, VS. ALBERT FREDERICH, DEFENDANT.
CONVICTED OF MURDER IN THE FIRST DEGREE, ALTERED BY SUPREME COURT UPON APPEAL, TO MURDER IN THE SEC- OND DEGREE.

THE PROSECUTING ATTORNEY WITH THE DEFENDANT AND COUNSEL CAME INTO COURT. THE DEFENDANT ALBERT FREDERICH WAS DULY INFORMED BY THE COURT OF THE NATURE OF THE INDICTMENT FOUND AGAINST HIM FOR THE CRIME OF MURDER IN THE FIRST DEGREE, COMMITTED ON THE 14TH DAY OF JULY,1887,OF HIS ARRAIGNMENT AND PLEA OF NOT GUILTY OF THE OFFENSE CHARGED IN THE INDICTMENT'' OF HIS TRIAL, AND THE VERDICT OF THE JURY ON THE 26TH DAY OF SEPTEMBER, 1891, '' GUILTY AS CHARGED IN THE INDICTMENT''.

THAT AFTER SAID VERDICT HAD BEEN RECEIVED AND JUDGMENT OF DEATH PASSED THEREON IN ACCORDANCE WITH LAW, AN APPEAL WAS PRES- ENTED TO THE SUPREME COURT OF THE STATE OF WASHINGTON, WHICH COURT AFTER DUE REFLECTION, CONSIDERATION AND EXAMINATION OF THE SAID CASEK DIRECTED THAT THE JUDGMENT OF DEATH RENDERED IN THIS COURT BE SET ASIDE AND VACATED, BUT THAT THE VERDICT OF THE JURY STAND
AND THIS COURT ENTER AND RENDER A NEW JUDGMENT OF GUILTY OF MUR- DER IN THE SECOND DEGREE.

THEREFORE THIS COURT PROCEEDING UNDER THE ORDER OF THE SAID SUPREME COURT AS IN SAID OPINION DIRECTED THIS DAY INFORMS THE SAID ALBERT FREDERICHS OF THE OPINION AND CONCLUSION OF SAID SUP- REME COURT IN SAID CASE AND ALLOWING THE SAID VERDICT SO TO STAND THIS THE SUPERIOR COURT OF THE STATE OF WASHINGTON FOR KING COUNTY THIS DAY ORDERS AND ADJUDGES AND DECREES THAT THE SAID ALBERT FREDERICH IS GUILTY OF THE CRIME OF MURDER IN THE SECOND DEGREE.

THE DEFENDANT ALBERT FREDERICH WAS THEN ASKED IF HE HAD ANY LEGAL CAUSE TO SHOW WHY JUDGMENT SHOULD NOT BE PRONOUNCED AGAINST HIM, TO WHICH HE REPLIES THAT he HAS none. AND NO SUFFICIENT CAUSE BEING SHOWN OR APPEARING TO THE COURT, THEREUPON THE COURT RENDER- ED ITS SAID JUDGMENT: AS FOLLOWS: THAT WHEREAS THE SAID ALBERT FREDERICH HAVING BEEN DULY CONVICTED IN THIS COURT OF THE CRIME OF MURDER IN THE FIRST DEGREE.

AND JUDGMENT OF DEATH RENDERED THEREON: THAT THEREAFTER THE SAID ALBERT FREDERICH PROSECUTED AN APPEAL TO THE SUPREME COURT OF THE SAID STATE OF WASHINGTON WHICH SAID SUPREME COURT AFTER DUE DELIBERATION, EXAMINATION AND REFLECTION ON THE RECORD OF SAID CASE DIRECTS THIS COURT THAT THE JUDGMENT OF DEATH REN- DERED BY THIS COURT BE SET ASIDE AND VACATED; THAT THE VERDICT OF THE JURY STAND; THAT THE COURT THIS DAY RENDER A NEW JUDGMENT OF GUILTY OF MURDER IN THE SECOND DEGREE.
IT IS THEREFORE CONSIDERED, ORDERED AND ADJUDGED/ BY THE COURT THAT THE SAID ALBERT FREDERICH IS GUILTY OF THE CRIME OF

MURDER IN THE SECOND DEGREE, AND THAT HE BE PUNISHED BY CONFINEMENT AT HARD LABOR IN THE PENETENTIARY OF THE STATE OF WASHINGTON FOR THE TERM OF TWENTY | 20 | YEARS AND THAT HE PAY THE COSTS OF THIS PROSECTUTION.
THE DEFENDANT ALBERT FREDERICH WAS THEN REMANDED TO THE CUS- TODY OF THE SHERIFF OF SAID COUNTY TO BE BY HIM DELIVERED INTO THE CUSTODY OF THE PROPER OFFICERS OF THE SAID PENETENTIARY.
OFFICE OF THE COUNTY CLERK OF KING COUNTY,
STATE OF WASHINGTON

I, W. B. SPENCER, COUNTY CLERK AND EX-OFFICIO CLERK OF THE SUPERIOR COURT OF THE STATE OF WASHINGTON FOR THE COUNTY OF KING, DO HEREBY CERTIFY THE FOREGOING TO BE A TRUE AND CORRECT COPY OF THE JUDGMENT DULY MADE ENTERED ON THE MINUTES OF THE SAID SUPERIOR COURT IN THE ABOVE ENTITLED ACTION, AND THAT I HAVE COMPARED THE SAME WITH THE ORIG- INAL; THAT THE SAME IS A CORRECT TRANSCRIPT THEREFROM AND OF THE WHOLE THEREOF.
Seal
ATTEST MY HAND AND THE SEAL OF THE SAID SUPERIOR COURT THIS 17TH DAY OF JUNE, 1892,.
W. B. SPENCER |CLERK|
(Exhibit B.)
IN THE SUPERIOR COURT OF THE STATE OF WASHINGTON FOR THE COUNTY OF KING.
THE STATE OF WASHINGTON, TO THE SHER- IFF OF KING COUNTY AND THE WARDEN AND OFFICERS IN CHARGE AT THE PENETENTIARY OF THE STATE OF WA SHINGTON, GREETING:

WHEREAS, ALBERT FREDERICH HAVING BEEN DULY CONVICTED IN THE SUPERIOR COURT OF THE STATE OF WASHINGTON FOR THE COUNTY OF KING OF THE CRIME OF MURDER AND JUDGMENT HAVING BEEN PRONOUNCED AGAINST HIM THAT HE BE PUNISHED BY CONFINEMENT AT HARD LABOR IN THE PENETENIARY/OF THE STATE OF WASHINGTON FOR THE TERM OF TWENTY |20| YEARS AND PAY THE COSTS OF THIS PROSECUTION ALL OF WHICH APPEARS TO US OF RECORD, AND A CERTIFIED COPY OF THE JUDGMENT BEING ENDORSED HEREON AND MADE A PART HEREOF.

NOW THIS IS TO COMMAND YOU, THE SAID SHERIFF OF KING COUNTY, TO TAKE AND KEEP AND SAFELY DELIVER THE SAID ALBERT FREDERICH INTO THE CUSTODY OF THE SAID WARDEN, OR OTHER OFFICER IN CHARGE OF THE PENETENTIARY OF THE STATE OF WASHINGTON AT YOUR EARLIEST CONVEN- IENCE.

AND THIS IS TO COMMAND YOU, THE SAID WARDEN AND OTHER OFFICERS IN CHARGE OF THE PENETENTIARY OF THE STATE OF WASHINGTON, TO RECEIVE OF AND FROM THE SHERIFF OF KING COUNTY THE SAID ALBERT FREDERICH CONVICTED AND SENTENCED AS AFORESAID, AND HE THE SAID ALBERT FRED-
ERICH KEEP AND CONFINE IN THE SAID PENITENTIARY FOR THE TERM OF TWENTY |20| YEARS AND THESE PRESENTS SHALL BE AUTHORITY FOR THE SAME. HEREIN FAIL NOT.
WITNESS. HON, T. J. HUMES.
JUDGE OF SAID SUPERIOR COURT, THIS 17TH DAY OF JUNE, A.D. 1892.
ATTEST MY HAND AND SEAL OF SAID DUPERIOR COURT THE DAY AND YEAR LAST ABOVE WRITTEN.
W. B. SPENCER, |CLERK|
Tx
IN THE SUPERIOR US Circuit COURT OF THE STATE District OF WASHINGTON IN AND FOR THE COUNTY OF
Northern Division
In the Matter of the Application of Plaintiff Albert Frederich for a Writ of Habeas Corpus Defendant
Petition
Received copy of the wihin this day of 189
Attorney for
FILED Aug 9 1892 IN THE U.S. CIRCUIT COURT.
A. Reeves Ayres.
CLERK>
BY R.M. Hopkins
Deputy
Tyler, Hays & Tyler,
ATTORNEYS
For Petitioner.
228 and 229 Occidental Block, Seattle.
Hill-Landes Building, Port Townsend.
